It was somewhat fortunate that Saya had made the prediction that with the presence of cars at the market there were, by extension, zombies present in the area. While Hayami would have been alert for the appearance of anything bloody and groaning, his awareness was already peaked thanks to this insight and he was cautiously making his way to the entrance of the market, eyes darting across the scenery for anything suspicious that was set to crop up. The silence lingering in the nocturnal air was doing little to calm his already frantic nerves, the heart pumping in the center of his chest racing with a rising tide of adrenaline that lay set to be unleashed the moment a zombie set foot in front of him, or if Saya took note of it's presence. "It's mighty quiet here now..." He whispered, Saya walking behind him, looking back to her and taking note of how she bore no weapon for their venture into the market.

This would quickly equal to bad news if she didn't have at least something to defend herself, even if it was just for right now. With that he paused and motioned for Saya to hand him the makeshift backpack they had made. A bit in the dark on what Hayami wanted with the backpack, Saya handed the weapon filled sack over to her fellow high school student, Hayami coming to rummage through it's cluttered contents and producing a small hatchet.

"Here, just in case." Hayami said to Saya, handing her the small axe like weapon. In truth, he was somewhat expecting her to put up a rouse on how she didn't need a weapon but, surprisingly enough, the pink haired schoolgirl did not have many words to say about Hayami's gesture save for a few...

"Well, alright but we might not have to use any weapons." She replied, taking the hatchet in hand as Hayami gave her a perplexed look. "Look up there, by the doors." Doing as he was told, Hayami looked up and, just where Saya directed his attention, a small pile of corpses lay motionless and mutilated. Gunshot wounds dotted their discolored and rotting flesh which gave rise to only one possible conclusion.

"...Someone's here." Hayami muttered, rising up as his mind began to bring forth possible outcomes to this situation. In one hand, things could get complicated if the ones held up inside were stingy with their resources. This was the only market Hayami saw for miles so this place was, perhaps, his only option left in terms of grabbing anything food related. "Well this could muck things up..." Hayami added, continuing forward with caution, ready to take on whom ever greeted him.

Saya, on the other hand, wasn't as tense as her comrade as her less defensive stance and approach was enough to show. The bespectacled schoolgirl examined the scene before her, carefully making note of the lack of activity in front of them. "Something's not right here..." However, there was signs of a struggle, bodies of zombified market workers lay sprawled out in random locations in the market. No doubt that there was a fight here but...it didn't look like many of them survived...

"Looks like there was a fight here..." Saya remarked, following Hayami inside. "You think anyone survived?"

"Doesn't look like it-" However, as Hayami grabbed hold of a basket...

"I...Is someone...there?" A voice called out, it's tone sounding masculine and also...pained.

"You doubt it, huh?" Saya smirked teasingly at Hayami's mistake, the high school student remaining silent before he coughed a bit.

"There's...always room for error." Indeed, but that aside, Hayami did manage to take note of the mystery person's voice, particularly of how he sounded as though he was in some form of pain or anguish. Gathering supplies would have to wait, it seems. "Oi, who's out there? Are you alright?"

Blood was covered in the orange based work uniform he wore, his hands clutching a particularly bloody area on his left arm. His breathing was shallow and his skin was losing color by the minute. Hayami could see just by looking at his face that...he didn't have long.

"Hayami, over there." Saya spoke up, tugging at Hayami's shirt to get his attention. The senior looked up and jerked a little where he stood, a trail of blood lay splattered on the shining white floors of the market, this path of red plasma leading up to the zombified corpse of another market employee, female it seems, that had been turned into one of...Them. Looking back at the man and then at the zombie...it didn't take much for them to know what was going down...and what was about to happen.

"Are you the only one left here...?" Hayami asked, wanting to make sure there were no other surprises here. The man nodded, before a ghastly cough followed his confirming gesture.

[ BGM - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FQ0V-lLrm... ]

"L-Listen...I...I don't have...much time..." The man forced out, "...I've seen it happen...to them...they get bitten...and they...they turn into those m-monsters...I...I-" The man halted in his words, a bloodied coughing fit replacing whatever else could be said.

“No, he’s right...” Saya cut in, her eyes narrowed in thought. “They don’t follow their eyesight like we do...I noticed a long time ago that the zombies had really off movement patterns. Like, some of them stand around, others wander in random places, sometimes running into junk that we would easily avoid. I was too panicked before to really realize it, but they’ve been blind this entire time.”

“So now the question is; how are they following us.” Hayami nodded as he turned back to the window, the teenager, idly plucking a bag of potato chips from the shelf nearby as he opened them up and started to chow down.

“Uh, maybe they can like...sniff us out?” Miku offered with a shrug, looking up as Shizuka was returning to the group with a few bottles of medicine cradled in her plump arms. Miku had forgotten how much wider the nurse was getting, but she was given a firm reminder of how much more her skirt could take of Shizuka’s broadening hips. The answer being not much more.

“Good guess, we haven’t really...bathed in awhile.” Hayami nodded, his cheeks tinging at the mention of not having a shower. He was usually a pretty clean individual, so not having a routine shower was starting to make him feels sticky and a little gross.

“But none of us stink that bad for there to really be a powerful scent.” Saya mentioned, hands on her hips.

“Also true, so that leaves...” Hayami hummed as he munched away on the salty potato crisps and tried to think back on anything worthwhile for information. Hayami’s eyes widened as the next possible solution to this biological mystery presented itself. “The argument...”

“Huh?”

“The argument between you and Miku.” Hayami repeated, a part of him a little reluctant to poke at that wound, but found that he had little choice in the matter. “That has to have been the loudest thing in the area at the time, right?”

“Err, well...” Saya hesitated, her hand rubbing on the back of her head as it became obvious that she and Miku were to blame for drawing in more of the Undead. “We were pretty loud back there, yeah...”

“Then that has to be it then.” Hayami clenched his fist around the empty bag of chips and turned back to the zombies. “They can follow us by sound. The louder the sound, the easier it is for them home in on our locations.”

“So as long as we’re sneaky, we can get past all the zombies?” Shizuka inquired, a finger on her softening chin as she tilted her head to Hayami.

“Basically, we just need to keep ourselves quiet if we can’t beat them upfront. So long as we’re quiet, I think their trail to us will taper off and they’ll stop the chase until something else loud presents itself.” Hayami explained. “So with that, how are we going to keep going with our plans. This place isn’t exactly safe with Them around...”

Shizuka’s stomach gurgled uncomfortably once more, reminding the nurse that she was dealing with a somewhat potent bellyache from all the food that was trying to digest within her. Shizuka patted her loudly grumbling middle to settle her gut down, but to little avail.

“Not to mention Shizuka-sensei’s upset stomach could alert more of Them to us...” Saya added, idly poking at the nurse’s beachball like paunch.

“S-Sorry, I’ll try to find some antacids to calm my tummy...”

“Still, even if that wasn’t the case, we need to figure out how to get gas from those pumps and find new clothes too...” Hayami pursed his lips as he gazed at the gaggle of walking corpses that were crowding the area. There was only seven of them, but that still outnumbered Hayami and his group by at least three. In order to get out of this situation alive, Hayami would need to come up with a plan to get the gas they needed for the trip or ignore it and simply go for the clothing instead.

info.description:
General Overview

Highschool of the Dead is an anime/manga series that takes you for a ride on the Zombie Apocalypse bus. An outbreak of a mysterious pathogen in Japan is rapidly spreading, uprooting the unsuspecting and killing those unprepared. Out of them all, high school kids manage to survive long enough and in the midst of it all are looking for their parents to make sure that, at least their families made it out of this disaster alive.

For information regarding the series and it's concepts -> http://highschool-of-the-dead.wikia.com/wiki/Highschool_of_the_Dead_Wiki

What's gonna go down
This interactive won't start at any point in the original series, more like it will have seperate stories that can start anywhere you like. It can involve the canon characters, original characters, or maybe even a mix of both. It's all up to you. I only ask that you try to stick to the premise of the original. Also, while it's not required, when making a character try to have them as an unsuspecting civilian. It helps add a feeling of urgency to their situation as opposed to making a military guy who has lots of guns and badassery at his disposal to kill zombies.


+Fetishes that can appear during this story...+
- Stuffing/Weight Gain
- Pregnancy


Standard rules apply...
- Only female characters are to expand. Although this doesn't exclude male characters from appearing at all in the interactive.
- Please put forth effort in your chapters.
- Nothing completely outlandish in regards of expansion.
- Let's try to avoid the overly gross situations such as toilet stuff and the like. Burps are fine (farts too, if you play it for comedy), but nothing past that please.
- This is an 18+ interactive so sexual situations are allowed, just...try not to go overboard with them. Use in moderation, basically and try not to have the story revolve too much around it. Highschool of the Dead might be (in)famous for it's...increased amounts of fanservice, but it doesn't get in the way of the story...I think?
